intro: Cyperus tenuifolius, commonly known as slender flatsedge, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flower heads. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, it thrives in wet or moist environments such as marshes and along waterways. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has a rhizomatous root system that aids in its spread. Its botanical features make it both an ecological indicator species and a potential invasive plant in certain regions.
